name: Zombie Infestation
objective: return to Wenric after killing all zombies
first_tasks: kill 20 zombies
tools: people around here have not been able to sleep for a week
description:
I be Wenric, a farmer by profession.
There's been something killing peoples in and 'round the farms here. Zombies or something. I can understands if you can't stomach the task but, just between you an' me real personal-likes, I don't know who else is gonna do it... All of us haves been goin' for a week now without sleep.
We've counted twenty zombies or so, so keep track as you kill 'em, if that's what you plans on doing.
Once you got 'em all, come back here and I'll gives you the 150 gold pieces that some of us have pooled together.

name: Maralee's Child
objective: return Peladan to Maralee
first_tasks: find Peladan

first_task_locations.description: northeast of the village, in the woods

tools: Maralee's husband took Peladan hunting: werewolves attacked Peladan and his father
Peladan went missing, but Maralee's husband was killed
Peladan and Maralee's husband have dark hair
description:
Hello, good people. I am Maralee. Two moons ago my husband took my son out hunting with him. They were attacked by those horrible wolf-creatures. They... they killed my husband and took my baby.
Others say that they took the baby away to eat him, but I know he's still alive. He's a beautiful little boy with dark hair like his father. He is three moons old and his name is Peladan.
They took him from my husband northeast of the village, in the woods.

name: Evalt's Missing Brother
objective: find Evan
first_tasks: find the Blue Lady

first_task_locations.description: along the west coast of Balduran's Isle

tools: Evan sought out the Blue Lady and disappeared
Evalt thinks that Evan is under the Blue Lady's spell
description:
I am Evalt, I fish for clan in these savage waters. Listen, outsider, may I ask you for help?
There is a witch on this isle. My brother called her the Blue Lady and those of us who ply these waters have all heard her singing at one time or another. My brother, Evan, heard her more than most. I think that he went to find her. I think that he is under her spell. I must go and find him. This witch might kill him. He is strong but he is under her spell. I fear that she will kill him before he realizes what is happening. Can you find my brother?
I don't know exactly where the Blue Lady is. I have the sense to avoid her, unlike Evan. But I have only heard her singing along the west coast of the island.

name: Jared and the Bear
objective: kill the bear pursuing Jared
first_tasks: find the bear

first_task_locations.description: on the other side of that bridge

quest_giver.name: Jared
quest_giver.description: a man running away from a bear

tools: NONE
description:
Oh, thank goodness someone came by.
I'm Jared. There's a bear on the other side of that bridge, and it's coming this way! I can't run anymore!
Please hold it off — I'll give you anything!

name: Nadarin and the Basilisk
objective: kill a basilisk and return to Nadarin for your reward
first_tasks: find the basilisk
tools: NONE
description:
Hey, you! Are you either bored or foolish? Either way, I, Nadarin, could use your services.
Some wiseacre tried to send a basilisk by freight and now it's broken free and is making a mess of one of the warehouses at the harbor.
There'll be 500 gold pieces for taking care of that on such short notice. Also, you might want these. They're an item I obtained from a fence I know in a far-away city. You never know, they might fit you.

name: An Offer from Taerom
objective: sell your ankheg shells
first_tasks: give your ankheg shells to Taerom Fuiruim
tools: ankheg armor is comparable to full plate with half the weight
there is an iron shortage
description:
Hello there, I'm Taerom Fuiruim, a blacksmith of some renown.
An interesting piece o' material you got there. Ankheg, if I'm not mistaken. Been a while since I seen the like, but if I remember correctly, it makes a fine set of armor. If properly treated it's comparable to full plate with half the weight!
If you're willing to part with your shells I'll give you 500 gold for the lot of them. No more can I offer with business as slow as it is.
Iron shortage hurting us all.

name: Gurke's Cloak
objective: return Gurke's cloak to him
first_tasks: find the tasloi holding Gurke's cloak

quest_giver.name: Gurke
quest_giver.description: an old man who is tired of hearing jokes about losing his cloak in Cloakwood

tools: a tasloi stole Gurke's cloak in Cloakwood
description:
Old Gurke had his famous cloak stolen right off his back by a batch of paltry tasloi.
Yeah, yeah, it's old news and if you make one crack about the Cloakwood being an appropriate place to lose it, at least, I'll put your liver on the menu. Now move on and let the next people in line have their laugh.
However, if you happen to find my cloak, I'll give you 280 gold pieces for returning it.

name: Ghorak the Diseased
objective: take Kereph's skull to Agnasia
first_tasks: find Kereph's skull

first_task_locations.description: behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs

tools: Ghorak was cursed with an illness for killing his brother
Agnasia knows how to cure Ghorak
description:
For your own health and that of your children, come no closer.
I, Ghorak, was cursed with this fell disease as punishment for my wickedness... No, your potions and magics are of little use. The only way to cure this sickness is to right the wrongs of the past. Behind a painting at the Three Old Kegs, you will find the skull of my brother, Kereph. Take it to Agnasia in The Lady's Hall. She will know what to do with it.

name: Palin and the Monsters
objective: save people from monsters
first_tasks: help Palin kill monsters
tools: NONE
description:
Good day to you, stranger. I'm called Palin. Excuse my, uhm, abruptness but I would ask your assistance.
Just east of this place there are monsters. They are attacking a small group of people. Please, if you have hearts, come and help me fight.

name: Farthing's Dolly
objective: return Farthing's doll to her
first_tasks: find Farthing's doll
tools: the gatekeeper won't let Farthing go and get her doll
description:
My name's Farthing. I'm only five. In a few years my papa will let me hunt. Are you allowed to hunt?
I've lost my dolly out in the woods. The gatekeeper won't let me go and get it. Can you get it for me?

name: Nadine and Euric
objective: give Euric a good luck talisman and return to Nadine
first_tasks: find Euric

characters.name: Euric
characters.description: Nadine's youngest son, who knows how to take care of himself

tools: Euric ran away from home
Nadine gives the player a good luck talisman
description:
I, Nadine, desperately need someone's help.
Euric, my youngest son, has run away again... He's always had a touch of the wanderer in him and he knows how to take care of himself, but... Oh, I'm just worried sick. This city gets more dangerous every day... If you find him, could you give him this good luck talisman? I'm sure we'd all sleep a little better.
Let me give you this necklace as a token of my thanks upon your return. I don't know if it's worth anything but it has been in the family for years.

name: Durlyle's Task
objective: bring the cloak that draped the village center back to Durlyle
first_tasks: find the cloak
tools: a storm sank the player's ship
there are beasts outside the village wall
description:
I am Durlyle, and I am glad to be meeting. I have but a mundane task to ask of you, if you hear me out?
The storm you felt that took your ship? It was fierce here too, and a cloak that draped the village center was cast to the wind. I think it is beyond the wall, and will not risk the beasts to get it. Will you?

name: A duel with Shar-Teel Dosan
objective: win duel against Shar-Teel Dosan
first_tasks: select the male party member who shall duel Shar-Teel Dosan

reward.description: Shar-Teel Dosan joins the player's party

tools: the player is the leader of a party of adventurers that has both men and women: Shar-Teel Dosan only duels men
if Shar-Teel Dosan wins the duel the player has to give 20 gold to her
Shar-Teel Dosan will kill anyone who tries to interfere the duel
description:
Hold, traveler! I, Shar-Teel Dosan, challenge your best warrior to a duel. I don't fight women, so only men should step forward.
I win, and you give me 20 gold. In the unlikely event that one of you bests me, I'll pledge my sword to your cause, however stupid it may be..
Will your champion step forward? I only fight men, so your women will have to be satisfied with just watching. Don't entertain any thoughts about cheating. If any of the rest of you try to interfere in this fight, I'll kill them outright.

name: Aldeth and the Group of Savages
objective: protect Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends from a group of savages
first_tasks: prepare for the savages' attack on Aldeth Sashenstar's cottage
tools: Aldeth Sashenstar has been holed up in a cabin for several days
the savages threatened Aldeth Sashenstar and his friends to stop hunting
the savages killed Elban
description:
I am Aldeth Sashenstar. You must understand that at the moment, I'm under a terrible amount of stress.
You see, my dear friend, there is a group of uncouth savages that has declared their intention of killing my friends and me. I've been holed up in this cabin for several days and have lacked the wherewithal to try to make an escape.
My friends and I come here every year to do some sport hunting. This year however, a group of woodland savages threatened us with bodily harm if we did not stop our hunting trip. Being civilized men, we realized that it's well within our rights to hunt where we damn well please. After a few more days of hunting, the crass woodmen lost all pretense of humanity and murdered Elban, one of my oldest friends.
I'm sure that they plan to attack our cottage here, so we had best be prepared.

name: Galken's Wardstone
objective: get the ward token that opens the way to the labyrinths beneath Durlag's Tower from Galken
first_tasks: settle Galken's bar tab

locations.name: Durlag's Tower
locations.description: a tower atop untouched dungeons filled with riches

tools: Galken gives the player the ward token if the player settles his bar tab
description:
I'm Galken. Hey, how'd you like to be supping on fine venison and tippin' back the good stuff?
I've the key to wealth legendary if you're up for it. No doubt you've heard of the labyrinth at Durlag's Tower, eh? And how she's been pillaged so often that fat nobles go there for picnics? Well, the TOWER has, but BELOW are dungeons untouched! I've a token, a ward token to be sure, that gives entry to them.
'Tis yours if you'll but settle my tab so I can leave this fine place... with all my limbs intact.

name: Another Mission for the Temple of Talos
objective: get the Dawn Ring from Travin and bring it to Talon Yarryl
first_tasks: find Travin

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: the evil god of thunder and destruction

groups.name: Lathanderian temple, Lathanderian church
groups.description: a church that does not respect Talos

tools: Stormherald Nallabir lost this past tenday's theological debate to a a representative of the Lathanderian temple in the Government District
the temple of Talos hired Travin to steal a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple
description:
It's Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos.
I have a chore for you that may prove interesting.
This is not a matter of negotiation or exploration. No, now you are to face true enemies of Talos.
Slanderous words have been said. Things did not go well for Stormherald Nallabir at this past tenday's theological debate in the Government District. The growing arrogance of the Lathanderian church is distasteful. Talos should be feared; their irreverence is insulting.
We have hired a thief, and he has stolen a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple.
Find Travin in the slums at night, collect the ring, and return it here.
Remember that the honor of Talos rests upon your shoulders.

name: Find the Kidnappers Who Buried Tirdir
objective: find the 3 men who buried Tirdir alive
first_tasks: talk to the gravekeeper about the man dressed in red

characters.description: man dressed in red, the youngest of the 3 men

groups.name: 3 men
groups.description: a group of three men who kidnapped Tirdir

tools: the player saved Tirdir from a grave
Tirdir was kidnapped: the 3 men who kidnapped Tirdir buried him alive in the grave
Tirdir tore off something from the shirt of the youngest man dressed in red
the gravekeeper might have spoken to the man dressed in red
description:
Thank you for saving me! I'm Tirdir. I was buried by the men who kidnapped me!
*cough* They held me for ransom from my family, and after my family had paid, they knocked me out. I remember being carried here and thrown into that grave next to another body! And then they buried me alive! *cough*
I don't know their names. There were three of them. The youngest carried me here. He dressed all in red... strange and bright as you please.
I woke up with this in my hand. I think I must have torn it off his shirt when he threw me in the grave. Perhaps it will help you find him.
You must stop them! I beg of you! There was someone who spoke to this man. Perhaps the gravekeeper. You should talk to him at least... he must have seen something!

name: Fulfill Your Duties to Talos
objective: speak to the believers of Talos
first_tasks: give guidance to the believers of Talos who seek the guidance of Talos

quest_giver.name: Acolyte Vilon
quest_giver.description: a priest of Talos, who hands the player the player's duties to Talos

characters.name: Talos, the Storm Lord
characters.description: an evil god of thunder and destruction

tools: the player is a favored of Talos
Acolyte Vilon sends the player a few believers who need the guidance of Talos
description:
Chosen of Talos! Over here! I, Acolyte Vilon, have words for you about your duties within the church!
As a favored of Talos, you will hear questions from the mewling dogs that seek the guidance of the Storm Lord. These weaklings seek guidance, and you are to give it. These worms are barely worthy of stepping upon the floor of the house of the Storm Lord! Nevertheless, you will hear them!
We all take our turn guiding the foolish. I shall send a few your way, and if you do well, perhaps you will not need to speak to any more. We shall see.
For now, guide them in the way of Talos. You must do what is best for the church, and that is all. Anything less and you will have your honors stripped.
Clear?

name: Anomen Returns Home After His Sister's Death
objective: investigate the murder of Anomen's sister
first_tasks: go to Lord Cor's home with Anomen
tools: NONE
description:
I am Anomen, a warrior priest.
I must discover the truth about my sister's murder. We must head for my father's home in the Government District of Athkatla!

name: Game of the Imps
objective: play the imps' game
first_tasks: place the gifts, and talk to the imps

reward.description: all of the drow's treasure from the sixth chest

tools: there are five empty chests
a famous person will appear in front of each empty chest: each famous person will give the player a gift that belongs to another famous person and will give a hint about the gift's owner
the player must place each gift to the correct chest behind each famous person
description:
We are two imps, little demonic people. We want to play a game.
Okay, big peoples... this is how our game will go! There is five chests here with nothings in them! In front of each empty chest, a famous big people will appear! Famous big people! Oh, yes, powerful famous big people! Each famous big people will give you a gift that belongs to another famous big people... and they will hints to you what gifts belong to them! If you thinks you knows which famous big people a gift belongs to, you puts it in the empty chest behind them, yes? Very simple!
Once you places all five, you comes and asks us! If you wrong, we laugh at you! If you right, we open the sixth chest! The sixth chest has all of the drow's treasure! All of it!

name: The de'Arnise Keep Has Been Invaded
objective: defeat the attackers at the de'Arnise Keep
first_tasks: find Daleson

first_task_locations.name: de'Arnise Keep
first_task_locations.description: the home of Nalia de'Arnise, a castle under siege

tools: if the attackers have breached the inner courtyard of the de'Arnise Keep, they will be hard to rout
Nalia de'Arnise's father would not leave the de'Arnise Keep
description:
I, Nalia de'Arnise, need a strong hand to help me. My land is under siege, and none of this rabble will aid me! And after all I've done for their kind, too! Please, can you assist me?
There is no time! I only hope that the attackers have not made it inside. If they have... if they have breached the inner courtyard, they will be hard to rout.
I will tell you what secrets I can. Perhaps you will be able to sneak in and attack from a more vulnerable spot. I hope Father is all right. He... would not leave.
Please, hurry to the de'Arnise Keep and find Daleson.

name: Shipment Shenanigans
objective: guard Aran Linvail's shipments, and report to him if anything happens
first_tasks: find Mook

quest_giver.name: Aran Linvail
quest_giver.description: a man leading a guild of thieves

tools: the player is meeting Aran Linvail for the first time
Aran Linvail's shipments and employees are disappearing on the docks
description:
Welcome to this place. I've looked forward to seeing you. I am, as you know, Aran Linvail.
Strange things are afoot on the docks. Shipments are disappearing, as are my employees with them. We are significantly weakened by this. I think it unlikely you would be captured or wooed to the enemy. If you go to the docks and bolster the guard on the shipments, it will strengthen our position.
Go at night, and you will find my present guard captain there already, a woman by the name of Mook. Take note of anything odd that happens.
Good hunting. Report to me if anything happens. Oh, and the reward I have set aside for you... I'll let you have some magical items. You will find them useful, I am sure.

name: Find Mimic's Blood for Jermien the Cowled Wizard
objective: bring Jermien the blood of a mimic so that he can complete his magical stone golem
first_tasks: find the blood of a mimic

reward.description: a handsome reward: a magical sword

tools: magical stone golems are known to be powerful and dangerous
description:
I am none other than Jermien... licensed Cowled Wizard for this region.
I am working on a golem of stone! A fine piece of magical craftsmanship, if I do say so myself! Few other mages have made the attempt, you see. This type of golem is quite powerful and dangerous... but I am more than skilled enough to control it. Once it's complete, I'll have an excellent servant.
Trouble is, I'm missing one of the crucial ingredients... the blood of a mimic. I'd pay handsomely for some, in fact. Hmmm... you look like the adventurous type... care to find me some?
Hmm. I seem to recall that I've got a magical sword around here that I won in a bet from a certain fool. I've no use for it, but it's valuable. Find me some mimic's blood and it's yours.

name: To Kill a Guild
objective: kill Aran Linvail
first_tasks: find a way to access Aran Linvail's sanctum

first_task_locations.description: the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house

quest_giver.name: Bodhi
quest_giver.description: a well-spoken woman, and an enemy to the Shadow Thieves

reward.description: Bodhi and the player's arrangement will be fulfilled

characters.name: Aran Linvail, the Shadowmaster
characters.description: the male leader of the Shadow Thieves

tools: the player has worked for Bodhi before
Aran Linvail is in the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house: the player needs a key to the basement
Tizzak is missing, and the Shadow Thieves may have him: he may know how to access Aran Linvail's sanctum
description:
Again, I require your talents. Now to the task at hand.
It is time to take down the leadership of the Shadow Thieves and throw them into a more permanent disarray from which they may not recover. You must invade their lair one last time. You must kill Aran Linvail, the Shadowmaster. Do this for me, and our arrangement will be fulfilled.
Aran is in the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house, so you need a key. The lock is likely unpickable. What good is a lock in a thieves' guild if any thief can pick it?
One more thing: Tizzak, an employee of mine, is missing, and the Thieves may have him. Find him, and he may tell you how to access Aran's sanctum. Go now!

name: A Mage Imprisoned?
objective: free Vithal
first_tasks: find Vithal

first_task_locations.description: in the cavern north of here

quest_giver.name: Uder Mordin
quest_giver.description: a man who witnessed a battle between Vithal and a powerful opponent

reward.description: Vithal was trying to uncover an artifact of old

characters.name: Vithal
characters.description: a powerful male mage, who was magically confined

tools: NONE
description:
I would be careful in this place, if I were you. Many dangers around many corners. You will be lucky to live. No real secrets for those that travel here frequently.
A trespasser got his due from someone he crossed. Well, I suppose it did not end in death, but it was a mighty battle regardless. I do not know who the aggressor was, but I know who lost.
That person was a mage of power, I am sure, though not powerful enough in the end. A pity too. He seemed intent on unearthing an artifact of old or some such.
And his reward for his effort? Worse than death, even though he seemed willing to share. Imprisoned, magically confined in the cavern north of here. Pity.

name: Kill Roger's Sea Troll
objective: kill the sea troll
first_tasks: find the sea troll
tools: NONE
description:
Hmmn. I don't remember seeing you down here before. Me name be Roger.
Oh, the sewers aren't so terrible. The guards don't be comin' down here, and my customers like to be somewhere... out of sight. 'Tis the beasties that are the biggest problem, especially of late. There's this sea troll. People have 'em as pets, and when they grow too large, they huck 'em down here to torment me.
I suppose I could part with a few coins for the deed. I tell you what... dispose of the sea troll beastie for me, an' I'll be pleased to pay you 500 gold pieces, aye?

name: Helping Irenicus' Captive Dryads
objective: take the three dryads' acorns to the Fairy Queen in the south end of the Windspear Hills
first_tasks: get the three dryads' acorns from Ilyich

characters.name: Ilyich
characters.description: the clan leader of Irenicus's duergar slaves

characters.name: Fairy Queen
characters.location: the south end of the Windspear Hills

tools: Irenicus has enslaved the three dryads
description:
We are the three dryads. You must help us get free of this... creature Irenicus! We are Irenicus's possessions, servants, and concubines.
You must get our acorns back from Ilyich, the clan leader of Irenicus's duergar slaves. He is somewhere within this dungeon. Please take the acorns to the Fairy Queen who lives in the south end of the Windspear Hills.

name: Tyrianna's Family
objective: escort Tyrianna to the building beside the temple in the docks and wait for Hurgis Baltezan to arrive
first_tasks: protect Tyrianna

quest_giver.name: William Reirrac
quest_giver.description: of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

characters.name: Tyrianna
characters.description: a noblewoman, one of the Morningales

characters.name: Hurgis Baltezan, "Hand of Torm"
characters.description: Tyrianna's godparent, an upstanding man serving the god of duty, comes from Baldur's Gate

groups.name: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Morningales
groups.description: a noble family known for their work in opposing the slave trade

tools: the Morningales have been murdered: Tyrianna survived her family
description:
I have a vital mission for you that must take precedence over all else.
We have received word of a great atrocity, one that must not be completed. There has been... murder is too weak a word. An entire family has been decimated. The Morningales have been a model of decency in this city, and their work in opposing the slave trade has earned them renown across the land. It also earned them many enemies. This past tenday has seen the family murdered in their homes, almost to the last. It would seem they were made examples of.
The time for justice will come, but what is important now is that someone survived, praise Helm. Tyrianna — she hid in a cellar while all others were executed. She must be protected until escorted from the city. Her survival will be a symbol to persevere in the fight against slavery, despite the ferocity of the enemy. You will go to a safe house we have set up, and you will make sure she remains secure. It is as secret as we could make it, though nothing is ever absolute.
In the morning, her godparent will arrive. He is from Baldur's Gate and will accept no other guards besides his own. You will see that she reaches his care. Go to the building beside the temple in the docks and await him. She should be safe in his care. Hurgis Baltezan is his name, and a more upright citizen you will not find. He earned the title "Hand of Torm" in his service to the god of duty.
The Order shall reward you with a suit of powerful armor for your good works.

name: Find Proof of Mae'Var's Treachery
objective: find evidence about Mae'Var's planned betrayal
first_tasks: show the papers to Gorch to gain access to Mae'Var's guild house

first_task_locations.description: the storefront in the central docks

quest_giver.name: Renal
quest_giver.description: one of the leaders of the Shadow Thieves, nicknamed "Bloodscalp"

characters.name: Mae'Var
characters.description: a good, ambitious male thief, the leader of Mae'Var's guild house

characters.name: Shadowmaster
characters.description: the guildleader of the Shadow Thieves

characters.name: Gorch
characters.location: the storefront in the central docks

locations.description: Mae'Var's guild house, one of Renal's guild houses to the south

tools: Renal will give the player papers which say that the player was being transferred by the Shadowmaster
the player is supposed to spy on Mae'Var from the inside
the player will need to reassure Mae'Var
description:
My name is Renal, as I'm sure you've been told. Renal "Bloodscalp"... a little nickname I've earned over time. Rather grisly, but it keeps the fearful in line.
One of my guild houses to the south is run by a rather ambitious fellow named Mae'Var. Good thief, but I never liked him. Now I know why. I've had some hints that he is getting too big for himself. Thinking of taking my place, I suspect, but I've had no real evidence to say that this is so.
I will give you papers saying you were being transferred by the Shadowmaster. You will spy on Mae'Var from the inside and find me the evidence that I need. You'll need to reassure Mae'Var, naturally. He won't know who you are, but I am confident that you are more than capable of this.
Just head to the storefront in the central docks area and speak to the storekeeper, Gorch. Show the papers to him, and he'll let you in the guild house proper.
I think you will find the reward adequate. 10,000 gold is no small fortune, though I think you deserve a little more. From my personal armory, a sword.

name: Catch of the Day
objective: help Thomas gather fish for his village
first_tasks: catch 16 fish

first_task_locations.name: Salmon Steps
first_task_locations.description: a nearby river rich in salmon

tools: NONE
description:
Traveler, I'm worried about my fellow villagers here in the village. I don't think that they eat enough nutritious, tasty fish.
Could you help me gather more? I simply can't catch enough fish for everyone, even if I'm a pro fisherman.
There is a river, Salmon Steps, bountiful in salmon near here. You could try your luck there, and catch 16 fish for me. I could pay you 32 shiny, green emeralds for the fish.

name: Gold. GOLD. GOLD!
objective: bring gold ore to Nila
first_tasks: find some gold ore

first_task_locations.description: ore veins deep in the ground

tools: the player is an enemy of Nila
description:
What are YOU doing here! If it was up to me, I'd never let you in the village.
Perhaps you'd like to mend our relations? Bring me some gold ore, the more the better. You can never have enough of it; it's so beautiful. My gold. I wish to have it all to myself. Too bad it's mainly found in the ore veins deep in the ground.
I guess you could have these melon seeds as a reward. I have no use for them; melons have nothing on gold.

name: That Belongs to a Library!
objective: recover writings of a lost culture for Jane
first_tasks: find the writings of a lost culture

first_task_locations.description: an ocean ruin far west of here

tools: the player is a famous hero
description:
There are ruins scattered on both land and the bottom of the sea, hero. These ruins tell us many things about the people who inhabited them: their hardships and hopes.
I'm not a hero like you, just your everyday librarian. I know of a submerged ruin in an ocean far west of here that you could explore. I implore you: find writings of a lost culture that lived in the ruin. The writings will be reduced to a lump of watery paper, if we don't recover them in time.
I have some unused bookshelves that I could give you in return. Even heroes need to civilize themselves with quality literature sometimes.

name: The Dragon at the End of It All
objective: slay the Ender Dragon, and report back to Weak Will
first_tasks: enter The End

first_task_locations.name: The End
first_task_locations.description: a mysterious place at the end of space and time

tools: NONE
description:
Me useless moron, say many people of this village. Me want to seem like a hero instead. Would make I happier, less thinking of dying.
Me know!!! Go to The End. That strange place at the end. Kill that big meanie Ender Dragon. Tell I how you did it, and me can tell everyone me did it!
Me give you something cool for me white lie.

name: Affordable Cooling
objective: bring some ice to Caleb
first_tasks: find some ice
tools: the player is a known villain
description:
I know of your dark deeds. I do not want any trouble from you.
However... if you have had a change of heart, I could use a little help. The hot desert air of this village is making me rather uncomfortable. I could stave off the heat, if I had some ice.
Tell you what, bring me ice, and you may still redeem yourself, villain, and net yourself 42 cacti. Ice is commonplace in snowy tundras, in frosted rivers.

name: A Cat on a Leash
objective: give a lead to Bruce
first_tasks: obtain a lead

quest_giver.name: Bruce
quest_giver.description: a happy man who owns a cat

tools: the player tamed the cat for Bruce
the player can craft a lead by combining some string with a slimeball
description:
Hello again! I'd like the thank you again for taming a cat for me. I'm really happy about my cat.
There is a small issue, though. I hate to trouble you further, but could you get me a lead? I just don't want my cat to wander off to dangerous places all alone. Did you know that you can craft a lead by combining some string with a slimeball?
I'll even pay you five emeralds for the lead.

name: Musings of a Madman
objective: bring Spook's new book to Kant
first_tasks: find Spook
tools: the player is a known villain
description:
Oh... You're that dark villain. This is just like one of my adventure novels! So exciting!
Perhaps you happen to know Spook. He's a kooky novelist who lives in an igloo to the north. You should get along with him splendidly! And whole you are there, you could even get his new book for me. I need to know what events unfold in that one!
Evil machinations need funding, don't they? Well, do my little book-fetching mission, and gain an enchanted book. I love books, but that one flew over my head... literally!.

name: Where to Hang...
objective: bring a painting to Sandy
first_tasks: obtain a painting
tools: the player is a known villain
description:
*scream of terror* I.. I.. I don't want any trouble. Please, I just want to live my live in peace.
You're not going to kill me? Sinister master, may this mere woman ask a tribute from you? Please, I'd like to have a painting.
In return, you will receive 16 TNT, perfect for ramping up explosions (Preferably elsewhere).

name: Head Hunter
objective: bring 5 zombie heads to Elena
first_tasks: obtain 5 zombie heads

reward.name: Elytra
reward.description: wings that let the player fly

tools: Elena has heard that the player helps people
powerful creepers are somehow related to obtaining the zombie heads
description:
I want all monsters in this world know how much I hate them. Perhaps I could get some of their heads to show my disdain toward them. Zombie heads should show all zombies that I am not to be trifled with.
You will certainly help me; many people in this village have told me that you are a resourceful and eager to work. Bring me five zombie heads. Powerful creepers are somehow related to getting the heads, but I don't know how exactly.
Get me the heads, and I'll give you wings that let you soar the skies: an Elytra.

name: A Box of Tricks
objective: give an Ender Chest to Loki
first_tasks: obtain an Ender Chest

first_task_locations.name: End Cities
first_task_locations.description: storied cities at the end of time and space

items.name: Ender Chests
items.description: chests whose contents are stored separately for all people

tools: the player can craft Ender Chests somehow
description:
I'm planning all sorts of new pranks that would make me a famous man here in the village. There's one integral item that I haven't been able to obtain: an Ender Chest. You know, the chests whose contents are stored separately for everyone?
I heard you can find Ender Chests in End Cities at the end of time and space. It should also be possible to craft them somehow. Can you obtain an Ender Chest? I would pay you well for one: you could have some powered rails that I used in one of my pranks.

name: A Service Dog
objective: bring a wolf to Miles the Moron
first_tasks: tame a wolf
tools: the player is a friend of Miles the Moron
description:
Me happy. See a friend. Hello friend!
Me would like me own wolfie. Could help me do things... Wolfies like Wide Woodland. A biggy forest. Tame a wolfie. Bring it to me. Me give you pumpkins. A load of pumpkins.

name: Safety First
objective: give a turtle shell to Pete
first_tasks: obtain a turtle shell
tools: NONE
description:
Me hurt me often. Other village-people suggest me get a helmet to protect me head.
Me seen turtles on sandy beaches. They never get hurt, because they hide in thick shells.
You give me a turtle shell? Make me safe? Me give you this sharp stick in return. It a diamond sword. It pretty, but me hurt plenty after touching it.

name: Lively Living
objective: help Greta redecorate her home
first_tasks: place the decorations Greta gives you in her home
tools: NONE
description:
My home is starting to look a bit drab. Could you help me redecorate my home here in Hamlet-By-The-Grass?
I don't know you that well; you definitely should come up with something fresh and interesting. Here. Take these decorations and place them in my home.
Afterwards, you can have this gold ingot.

name: Notes in Blocks
objective: bring 24 note blocks to Zana
first_tasks: obtain 24 note blocks

items.description: note blocks, used to play musical notes

tools: the player is an enemy of Zana
the player can craft note blocks from wooden planks and redstone dust
description:
I am most certainly not going to sing your praises, you nasty cretin.
On the contrary, it would be music to my ears if you helped me reach my musical ambitions. No one in this village seems to care for music, or any of the arts for that matter. For starters, obtain 24 note blocks. It has to be exactly 24, because there are that many different notes to play. It's possible to craft note blocks from wooden planks and redstone dust.
Bring the 24 note blocks to me. I'll let you have an old music disc of mine.

name: Uncharted Waters
objective: bring 6 tropical fish to Mickey
first_tasks: catch 6 tropical fish
tools: NONE
description:
I've caught a mountain of salmon and cod. Yet, there are still some more exotic fish that have eluded my fishing rod.
Traveler, do you like fishing? May I ask you to catch 6 tropical fish for me? These sort of fish are common in vast oceans of our world. I yearn to take a look at new kinds of fish. I could even try to breed them.
If you happen to give me 6 exotic fish, I'll be glad to reward you with an enchanted fishing rod of mine. A best kind of tool for a passionate fisher.

name: A Brotherhood Betrayed
objective: clear Bradon's name
first_tasks: find Raynil Dralas, and make him tell you the truth about Bradon's supposed vampirism

characters.name: Bradon
characters.description: Erline's husband, who was killed by Raynil Dralas

tools: Raynil Dralas killed Bradon in Bradon and Erline's home: the Bruma city watch found the body of a dead beggar in Bradon and Erline's's home afterwards
Raynil Dralas convinced Carius that Bradon was a vampire
no one has seen Bradon out in the daylight: Erline explains that Bradon works at night and sleeps on days
Erline has seen Raynil Dralas before
description:
I can't believe this is happening. Please... please. I need your help. My husband was no vampire! It's ridiculous! No one will listen to me! Forgive me. I loved my husband dearly, and to lose him this way makes no sense. Anything you can do to help would be wonderful. This is all happening so fast.
I came home only just a few hours ago. I found the door open, and my Bradon dead. Standing over him was a Dunmer. I screamed and ran out into the street. Some city watch were nearby and heard me I suppose, as they arrived quickly. I heard the Dunmer identify himself as Raynil Dralas. He said he was a vampire hunter and that Bradon was his mark. The guards seemed to know about Raynil, and after a search of the house, the body of some beggar was found stashed in our basement. The guards sent for Carius, who is an investigator for crimes here in Bruma. In minutes, Raynil convinced Carius that Bradon was a vampire.
Why would he stash a body in his own house? That's ridiculous! And another thing. The guards are making a big deal out of no one seeing Bradon out in the daylight. Well of course that's the case! He works at night, and has to sleep during the day. Why does that make him a vampire? It's all that Raynil character. I don't trust him. The thing that bothers me the most is that I swear I've seen him before. Of course he says he's never been here. Look, there isn't much more to say. Please... help me clear my husband's name.
Just find Raynil Dralas, and make him tell you the truth. I swear, he's a liar!

name: The Great Divide
objective: resolve the trouble of doubles
first_tasks: kill the demented citizens of Split

reward.description: Horkvir Bear-Arm will make it worth the player's while

locations.name: Hill of Suicides
locations.description: a nasty place where people who have committed suicide end up

tools: a wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one demented and other manic
Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there are rules and he does not want to end up on the Hill of Suicides
description:
Yes, I, Horkvir Bear-Arm, can take a moment to talk with you.
I'd get more work done if it weren't for my layabout double living in town. Terrible drain on productivity. Never know who's who. It's been a problem for too long.
A wizard did it. Stupid layabout mage. Had a theory about each of us having a Manic and Demented side. He decided to test the theory. Cast a spell. Split us all in two. Do we get twice the work done? No! Ridiculous. We're not allowed to take care of it either. There are rules. And I don't want to end up on the Hill of Suicides. You, on the other hand....
Get rid of that Demented bunch. Useless, anyway. Don't get a lick of work done around Split. If you get rid of them, I'll make it worth your while.

name: Everything In Its Place
objective: liberate Ranarr-Jo and others from mind control
first_tasks: gain Kishashi's trust
tools: Ranarr-Jo thinks that Cindanwe can control minds
description:
I'm Ranarr-Jo.
Perhaps you could help us? But why should I trust you? You might be, you know... one of Them.
Our situation is desperate, she controls our minds... but wait, I've said too much.
Talk to my Kishashi. If she will trust you, I will trust you.

name: The Siren's Deception
objective: get Maelona's family heirloom back from an all-female gang of thieves that prey on the married men of Anvil
first_tasks: find leads about the all-female gang

first_task_locations.name: Flowing Bowl
first_task_locations.description: a seedy tavern in Anvil, located outside the city walls near the waterfront

tools: Gogan was robbed by the all-female gang: Maelona's family heirloom was among the things that the gang took from him
the city guard have not done much about the all-female gang: the men they rob are too embarrassed to report the gang
description:
I'm Maelona. How would you like to get my husband, Gogan, out of hot water?
Believe me, he'll need all the help he can get to worm his way out of this one. To think he'd fall for the gang's scheme... agh! I could kill him! I'm sorry... I'm rambling and got you confused. Let me explain.
The women in the gang use their wiles to lure men out to some remote location and rob them blind. It's been going on for some time now. The city guard hasn't done very much about it, because frankly, the men who are robbed are so embarrassed, they don't want to report it. Take for example that good-for-nothing husband of mine, Gogan. He cared more about their charms than my own.
When Gogan was, uh... with the women, they took something quite valuable from him. No... it's not what you're thinking. He was carrying a precious family heirloom with him when he was lured out to their lair. It was a small ring given to him on our wedding day. The ring belonged to my mother, and has been in the family for generations. I'm willing to give you all the money I have to get it back. 100 gold. Can you help us?
All I can tell you is that the best place to start is at The Flowing Bowl. It's a tavern located outside the city walls near the waterfront. The Flowing Bowl attracts the worst Anvil has to offer. Always be on your guard.

name: Boots of Springheel Jak
objective: find out where Springheel Jak is buried, and retrieve his boots for the Gray Fox
first_tasks: search for clues in the Earl of Imbel's house

quest_giver.name: Gray Fox
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Thieves Guild

items.name: Savilla's Stone
items.description: a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder

characters.name: Earl of Imbel, Jakben
characters.description: a man , and the last known descendant of Springheel Jak

tools: the Gray Fox has used Savilla's Stone, again, to find out that he needs another special item, the boots of Springheel Jak, to move forward with his plans
the Earl of Imbel is the last known descendant of Springheel Jak
description:
Further use of Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need another special item to move forward with my plans. I need the boots of Springheel Jak. He is a famous thief that died some 300 years ago. Legend has it that he was buried with his boots on.
Find out where Springheel Jak is buried and bring me back those boots. Will you do this for me? It pays well.
The Earl of Imbel is the only descendant of Springheel Jak's line that I have been able to locate. His name is Jakben, and he lives somewhere in the Imperial City. There might be a clue in the Earl's house.

name: Infiltration
objective: infiltrate the Blackwood Company, and find the secret of their success
first_tasks: join the Blackwood Company

quest_giver.name: Modryn Oreyn
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

characters.name: Argonian
characters.description: a member of the Blackwood Company who was interrogated by Modryn Oreyn

tools: the information Modryn Oreyn got from the Argonian was valuable
the player will be on their own: they should steer clear of their fellow Fighters Guild members
description:
While the information we got from the Argonian was valuable, we need more. I want you to infiltrate them. See how they work from the inside.
I want you to get to Leyawiin and join the Blackwood Company. Find the secret of their success. You'll be on your own. Steer clear of me and all of your Fighters Guild brothers. It'll be rough going, but you can do it.
Good luck.

name: Meridia Smites Necromancers
objective: wipe out a band of necromancers
first_tasks: find the necromancers

quest_giver.name: Meridia
quest_giver.description: the lady of light, one of the Daedric Princes

tools: the player has summoned Meridia by the detritus of the profane
Meridia hates the undead and necromancers
description:
By the detritus of the profane, I am brought forth. And by your offering, you have made the profane your interest, mortal.
The undead are foul, unnatural things. Some of my rivals take pleasure in these abominations. Not Meridia. I wish these creatures destroyed. Hidden behind a door, deep in Howling Cave, are necromancers. They rob graves for the materials to raise their undead armies.
Find these necromancers. Destroy them and their abominations. Do this, and earn the gratitude of Meridia. You shall have the Ring of Khajiiti and go with my blessing.

name: A Shadow Over Hackdirt
objective: find Dar-Ma
first_tasks: find clues about Dar-Ma's whereabouts from Etira Moslin

first_task_locations.name: Hackdirt
first_task_locations.description: an isolated village, south of Chorrol

quest_giver.name: Seed-Neeus
quest_giver.description: a worried mother, and a trader

reward.description: Seed-Neeus' friendship and gratitude to the end of her days

characters.name: Blossom
characters.description: Dar-Ma's beloved female horse, whom Dar-Ma would never abandon

tools: Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin, because Seed-Neeus was not feeling well
Dar-Ma went with Blossom
description:
I'm Seed-Neeus. I don't mean to impose, but I'm hoping you can help me. My daughter, Dar-Ma is missing and I don't know what to do.
Dar-Ma never came back from Hackdirt. I'm dreadfully worried something may have happened to her. Can you help?
Dar-Ma was supposed to make a delivery to Etira Moslin in Hackdirt, so I would start there. Hackdirt is a rather isolated village, south of Chorrol. We do some business with the trader there. Small volume, but she pays well. Normally I make the deliveries, but I wasn't feeling well so Dar-Ma insisted on going this time. In case it may be useful, she was with Blossom -- her horse, I mean. Dar-Ma loves that animal, and would never willingly abandon her.
If you find my daughter, you have my friendship and gratitude to the end of my days!

name: Bear Season
objective: bring the fangs of the 6 West Weald Bears as proof to Thorley Aethelred
first_tasks: kill 6 West Weald Bears to protect Thorley Aethelred's flock of sheep

reward.description: Thorley Aethelred will reward the player well

tools: Thorley Aethelred built a fence around his sheep: it did not help with his bear problem
description:
It seems I'm having a bear problem and I just don't know what to do.
I've had attacks on my small flock of sheep lately. I was hoping that building a fence would solve the problem, but it hasn't helped at all. Then, one day when I was just about to step outside, I saw the culprits. A group of West Weald Bears was dragging away a sheep carcass. There's no way I can fight those ferocious beasts off on my own.
If you could thin the population a bit, they would probably leave the area. Kill six of the things, bring me their fangs as proof, and I'll reward you well.
Please, you're my only hope.

name: Alchemy Training
objective: bring a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad to Sinderion
first_tasks: find a bottle of Tamika's, and Surilie Brothers vintages of year 399

quest_giver.name: Sinderion
quest_giver.description: a wine enthusiast, and a master alchemist

tools: the player asked Sinderion to train them
description:
Training? Oh, I'm afraid that's not my area of expertise. I'm very focused on wines right now, you see.
Wonderful thing, wine. It's all about the balance. The flavor, the bouquet, the consistency... just wonderful. I'm sorry, what? Training... right. I'll make you a deal: you fetch me a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad, and I'll think about it.
Both vineyards, Tamika's and Surilie Brothers. Vintage 399. Oh, what a good year that was...

name: Canvas the Castle
objective: recover a painting, and bring the culprit to justice
first_tasks: gather clues about the identity of the culprit

items.name: a painting
items.description: a stolen painting depicting Count Valga

tools: someone stole a painting from Countess Arriana Valga's bedchamber: do not accuse the wrong person
Countess Arriana Valga gives the player some keys that allow the player access to many of the restricted areas in Castle Chorrol
description:
I am Countess Arriana Valga of Chorrol. I wish I had time to chat, but I'm afraid I am in the middle of an investigation.
You seem the trusting type. Perhaps you can assist me? It seems someone has taken away an heirloom that is quite dear to me. I want you to help me recover a stolen painting. The painting was of my lost love, the Count Valga, and it has been stolen from my bedchamber. If you find the painting, and bring the culprit to justice, you shall be justly rewarded.
I suggest you begin to gather clues. And I warn you: do not accuse the wrong person, or I shall be quite cross with you. Here are some keys. They should allow you access to many of the restricted areas in Castle Chorrol.

name: Teekeeus' Old Rival
objective: find a way to get rid of Earana
first_tasks: determine what Earana is after

quest_giver.name: Teekeeus
quest_giver.description: one of the leader of the Mages Guild

characters.name: Earana
characters.description: a female mage who has been kicked out of the Mages Guild

tools: the player asked a recommendation from Teekeeus
Earana and Teekeeus have an unpleasant history: Earana does not care for Mages Guild regulations, and believes Teekeus is mis-using his powers
description:
I'm afraid I can't just write one out of hand. That would be against protocols, you see. If perhaps you can clear up a small matter involving Earana, you can prove your loyalty to the guild and earn my recommendation.
Earana and I have an unpleasant history. She does not care for Guild regulations, and errantly believes I am mis-using my powers. I have seen that she is in town. Though she has not approached me, I know she wants something.
I would like you to find out what it is. Determine what Earana's after, and how we may be rid of her. I do not want her here, spreading her lies.

name: Addiction
objective: return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
first_tasks: find the Chalice of Reversal

quest_giver.name: Thadon
quest_giver.description: Duke of Mania, a Felldew addict

items.name: Chalice of Reversal
items.description: a chalice that makes the world a much brighter and happier place after eating Felldew

tools: Thadon is inebriated from withdrawal effects of Felldew
description:
Ahh yes, THERE you are! You couldn't imagine how long I, Thadon, the Duke of Mania, have been waiting for you. So little to do, and so much time. Hmm, could you, in fact, imagine just how long I've been waiting? I don't think you could, but I might be wrong.
It felt like rather a long time, but then long times get longer when you're standing around thinking about them. A curious thing, that. Long roads get longer too, if you're thinking about them, but what about long words? They don't change nearly as much. Long, short -- it all ends up the same. Dust and tears. Usually tears first, then the dust. Dust can't cry, you see. That would be... well, amusing. You know what's NOT amusing? I don't have my Chalice of Reversal. It makes me sad. When I get sad, I don't care to do much of anything. I certainly don't care to help people who show up on my doorstep wanting something. Are we getting the picture here?
The Chalice of Reversal is one of my favorite toys. Does wonders for creativity. Well, not by itself, but it helps. Is this making sense? Look, you eat the Felldew, then use the chalice, and find the world a much brighter and happier place. Honest. But I don't have it. So I can't eat Felldew, because that would just be bad. I mean, really bad. Find my chalice!

name: The Lonely Wanderer
objective: assassinate Faelian without attraction the attention of Adamus Phillida
first_tasks: find Faelian

first_task_locations.name: Imperial City
first_task_locations.description: a large city with many districts

quest_giver.name: Ocheeva
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: a bonus if the player kills Faelian indoors with no other people around

characters.name: Faelian
characters.description: a male high Elf, who fancies long walks, living somewhere in the Imperial City

characters.name: Adamus Phillida
characters.description: a male Imperial Legion captain, who has dedicated his life to eradicating the Dark Brotherhood

tools: finding Faelian will be challenging: the player should speak to their fellow Dark Brotherhood members for advice
Adamus Phillida does not tolerate Dark Brotherhood operations within the Imperial City
description:
In the Imperial City there lives a High Elf who must be removed from existence. Finding this person may prove... challenging. Are you interested?
Your target is a High Elf named Faelian. He lives somewhere in the Imperial City, and fancies long walks. Unfortunately, that's all we know. We don't know which district he calls home, which establishments he frequents, or anything about his schedule.
This contract will require a bit of detective work. I suggest you to speak to your fellow Brothers and Sisters and see if they can offer any advice. Ah yes, there is one more thing. The Imperial City is also home to an Imperial Legion captain named Adamus Phillida. Phillida has dedicated his life to eradicating the Dark Brotherhood. He will not tolerate our operations within the Imperial City.
When that happens, he tends to make our lives uncomfortable. Let's not give the good captain any reason to go poking around in our affairs, hmm? If possible, do away with Faelian someplace out of the way. Definitely indoors, with no other people around. A secure location, with no witnesses. This will make it look like a simple murder. Phillida will be none the wiser, and you'll receive a nice bonus.
Now go, and may the Reaper of Souls go with you.

name: Blood of the Divines
objective: recover the blood of a Divine for Martin
first_tasks: talk to Jauffre about obtaining the blood of Tiber Septim

characters.name: Jauffre
characters.description: the male Grandmaster of the Blades

characters.name: Tiber Septim
characters.description: the legendary male Emperor who ascended to divinity

groups.name: Blades
groups.description: the intelligence service working under the Imperial Emperor

groups.name: Divines
groups.description: the gods of the Empire who do not manifest themselves in the mortal world

groups.name: Daedra
groups.description: immortal, fickle, infamous beings who have artifacts in the mortal world

tools: Martin needs the blood of a Divine for the ritual to open the portal to Camoran's Paradise in addition to the first item, the blood of a Daedra
description:
I've figured out another item needed for the ritual to open the portal to Camoran's Paradise. The second item is the counterpart to the first: the blood of a Divine.
This was a terrible puzzle to me. Unlike the Daedra, the gods have no artifacts, and do not physically manifest themselves in our world.
How then to obtain the blood of a god? But Jauffre solved it. The blood of Tiber Septim himself, who became one of the Divines. This is a secret remembered only by the Blades, passed down from one Grandmaster to the next.
Jauffre should tell it to you himself.

name: The Ghost Ship of Anvil
objective: return the crystal ball to Varulae
first_tasks: get Varulae's crystal ball from a chest in the Serpent's Wake's hold

first_task_locations.name: Serpent's Wake
first_task_locations.description: a haunted ship right beside the player in Anvil

quest_giver.name: Varulae
quest_giver.description: a frustrated woman, and the owner of the Serpent's Wake

tools: Varulae sent the crew of Serpent's Wake to the Summerset Isle to retrieve Varulae's crystal ball: someone murdered the crew when they came back to Anvil
Varulae gives the player a key
description:
This is a travesty. A complete and utter travesty. The crystal ball is just sitting there in the hold, but I'll be damned if I'm going back onboard. And nobody will help me. Nobody! Not with those spirits roaming the decks. I don't suppose you'll help me? No, of course you won't...
Wait... Did you actually say you'd help me? I've been going out of my mind ever since my crew was murdered! This is my ship, you see. The Serpent's Wake. I hired the crew to sail to Summerset Isle to retrieve a family heirloom, my mother's crystal ball. They made the journey, and arrived back all right, but then... Someone murdered them! All of them! Now their spirits are haunting the ship!
The crystal ball is in a chest in the ship's hold, but I can't get to it. I made it as far as the captain's cabin, but the spirits nearly killed me! Get the crystal ball and return it to me here, and I'll make it worth your trouble. Here, you'll need this key. Thank you so much!
There will be a reward waiting for you! It's the captain's enchanted cutlass. I managed to grab it when I was in his cabin, before his spirit chased me out!

name: Hircine's Unicorn Hunt
objective: bring an unicorn horn to Hircine
first_tasks: hunt the unicorn

quest_giver.name: Hircine
quest_giver.description: the lord of the hunt, one of the Daedric Princes

tools: the player summoned Hircine
description:
Summoned by prey. The hare crouches before the fox's muzzle. Perhaps I, Hircine, shall task you, mortal. Set you to hunt for my amusement.
In Harcane Grove is a quarry worthy of the chase. First named, last tamed, the unicorn runs wild there. Bring me this creature's horn, mortal. If you dare. Do taste its flesh and drink its blood. Never waste the spoils of a kill.
Please me, hunter, and you shall have my token, Saviour's Hide, and wear it well. Hereafter, take your prey, and whisper my name.

name: Paradise
objective: kill Mankar Camoran to unmake his Paradise, and retrieve the Amulet of Kings
first_tasks: travel through Martin's portal to Mankar Camoran's Paradise

characters.name: Mankar Camoran
characters.description: a dangerous man, and the player's enemy

tools: Martin has everything in place for the Mysterium Xarxes: Martin will open the portal whenever the player is ready
the portal Martin creates through the Mysterium Xarxes will close behind the player: the player will have to find another way back
Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place
description:
I have everything in place for the ritual. I'll open the portal whenever you're ready. I don't know what you'll find in Camoran's Paradise. I do know the portal I create through the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will close behind you. You'll have to find another way back.
I believe that Mankar Camoran acts as the "anchor" for Paradise, just as a sigil stone anchors an Oblivion Gate in place. Kill Mankar Camoran, and you will unmake his Paradise.
Farewell, my friend. Our fate is in your hands. Bring back the Amulet of Kings. Brace yourself.

name: The Killing Field
objective: reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
first_tasks: meet up with Rallus and Antus

quest_giver.name: Valus Odiil
quest_giver.description: an old warrior turned farmer, and a worried father

locations.name: Odiil Farm
locations.description: Valus Odiil, Rallus and Antus' farm, not far from Chorrol

tools: Rallus may know more about the creatures that attacked the Odiil Farm
description:
My sons! Have you seen my sons Rallus and Antus? They're going to fight off the creatures at our farm, but I fear for their safety.
For the last few days, we've suffered attacks from these creatures at our farm not far from Chorrol. They're coming from someplace in the Great Forest. I don't know where, but Rallus may know more by now. My boys will take up the fight even if the guards won't. Doesn't matter if it's outside the town walls - it still affects us all. They expect me to go with them, but... I fear in my old age, I'm not the warrior I once was. Would you... would you go in my place?
I'm supposed to meet them at Weynon Priory. You'd best get whatever supplies you need now, so you can get there in time.
I... I need a drink to calm my nerves. Please, excuse me.

name: The Hist
objective: return to the Blackwood Company hall to destroy the Hist Tree and anyone that stands in your way
first_tasks: find Ri'Zakar's key that opens the door to the Hist tree

first_task_locations.name: Blackwood Company hall
first_task_locations.description: the headquarters of the Blackwood Company

quest_giver.name: Modryn Oreyn
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

items.name: Hist Tree
items.description: an abominable tree, and the source of the Fighters Guild's problems

characters.name: Ri'Zakar
characters.description: the leader of the Blackwood Company, and a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel

tools: Modryn Oreyn has one final duty for the player to perform
everyone is in danger, as long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap from the Hist Tree
Ri'Zakar will have the Hist Tree well guarded
description:
It is time for decisive action. I have one more duty for you to perform. It is clear to me what must be done. The Hist Tree must be destroyed. This tree is the source of our problems. It is an abomination of nature, and it must be destroyed. As long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap, we are all in danger. I fear they no longer know what they do.
You must find a way to destroy the Hist, though I can imagine Ri'Zakar will have it well guarded. He's a warrior, a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel. He'll keep his prize tree locked away. You'll need to find his key.
Expect an unfriendly welcome at their hall. Finish it.

name: Bittneld and Emfrid
objective: help to bring Emfrid and Bittneld the Curse-Bringer together
first_tasks: talk to Emfrid about Bittneld the Curse-Bringer, and talk to Bittneld the Curse-Bringer about Emfrid

quest_giver.name: Casta Scribonia
quest_giver.description: a female writer, and the author of 'Woman Gone Wild'

characters.name: Emfrid
characters.description: the female proprietor of the Grey Mare

tools: NONE
description:
Hello. I'm Casta Scribonia. The writer. Author of 'Woman Gone Wild'.
Who is the fairest of them all? Other than myself? Emfrid, the proprietor of the Grey Mare is lovely. She and Bittneld the Curse-Bringer, the guard captain would be a nice couple....
Perhaps you could bring them together somehow... try talking to them both about each other?

name: Join the Mages Guild
objective: advance in the Mages Guild
first_tasks: receive a recommendation

first_task_locations.description: each local guild hall in Cyrodiil

quest_giver.name: Carahil
quest_giver.description: one of the guild hall leaders of the Mages Guild

tools: the player wants to join the Mages Guild: Carahil makes the player an Associate of the Mages Guild
all recommendations must be sent to the Council of Mages before the player can enter the Arcane University
description:
Hello there. Is there something with which I can assist you? Perhaps you're curious about joining the Mages Guild?
All right, then. You're now an Associate of the Mages Guild. Congratulations! You'll need to receive a recommendation from each local guild hall in Cyrodiil to advance in the guild, and be given any sort of responsibility. They can be done in any order, but they all must be sent in to the Council before you can enter the Arcane University.

name: The Collector
objective: recover the complete set of 10 ancient statues for Umbacano
first_tasks: find the 10 ancient statues

reward.description: a double pay for each ancient statue

groups.name: Ayleid
groups.description: an extinct, ancient race of people

tools: Umbacano has invited the player here to his house: the ancient Ayleid statue that the player recently sold cheap to an anonymous merchant is placed on a table
description:
Thank you for coming.
You may recognize that statue over there on the table. The very one that you recently sold -- for less than its true worth.
As you may know, I am somewhat of an enthusiast for Ayleid antiquities. In my own modest way, I have amassed a rather considerable collection.
I have recently become interested in obtaining the complete set of these ancient statues. I believe that ten still exist within the various ancient Ayleid Ruins. No mere shopkeeper knows their true worth.
If you bring them to me when you find them, I will pay you double for each one.

name: Seeking Your Roots
objective: collect more Nirnroot
first_tasks: collect 10 samples of Nirnroot for Sinderion

first_task_locations.name: Shadeleaf Copse
first_task_locations.description: a part of the Great Forest northeast of here

reward.description: a free bottle of the Elixir of Exploration
a discount for buying more Elixir of Exploration from Sinderion

items.name: Elixir of Exploration
items.description: a multi-purpose potion for dungeon explorers

tools: the player has brought Sinderion a sample of Nirnroot for examination
the Elixir of Exploration requires Nirnroot
the formula for the Elixir of Exploration describes many magnitudes of the brew: Sinderion wrote a short missive about it for the Imperial Alchemy Symposium
description:
So, you've brought something for me to examine?
Yes, this is a genuine Nirnroot sample. Very nice quality in fact. Hmmm... that gives me an idea. Since you already know what they look like, do you feel up to a bit of a collecting expedition?
A few years ago, an adventurer not unlike yourself sold me a musty old tome containing alchemical formulas. Most of them were worthless. But one of the moldy pages contained the recipe for a potion known as an Elixir of Exploration, a sort of "ultimate dungeon delver's" brew. The formula looked sound, except it required an extremely rare ingredient. Yes, you guessed it, the Nirnroot. I put the book aside, because frankly, I had so many other delicate experiments going on that I just didn't have the time to go plant hunting. Now that you're here, that changes things.
The Elixir of Exploration is a multi-purpose potion that was obviously created with the dungeon explorer in mind. The formula describes many magnitudes of the brew. If you're interested, I wrote a short missive about it for the Imperial Alchemy Symposium. You bring me 10 samples of Nirnroot, and I'll make the Elixir of Exploration available to you at a huge discount as well as give you one for free.
The best place for you to start would be Shadeleaf Copse, which is a part of the Great Forest northeast of here. Good luck, and hurry back with more of the Nirnroot!

name: The Gravefinder's Repose
objective: help Malene deal with Raelynn the Gravefinder
first_tasks: kill Raelynn the Gravefinder

first_task_locations.name: Moss Rock Cavern
first_task_locations.description: a cave just north of Malene's inn

tools: Malene has seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the entrance to Moss Rock Cavern
description:
Thank goodness someone that can help is here! I don't know how to make this request any simpler, but to put it bluntly, Raelynn the Gravefinder must die.
A few months ago, that witch of a Necromancer decided to inhabit Moss Rock Cavern just north of my inn. I don't know what she does in there; frankly, I don't want to know. However, I do know that after she arrived, the woods at night became unsafe.
I've seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the cave entrance. Now, this area's getting a bad reputation and my business has waned. Every day, it seems the number of undead increase.
If someone can get into the cave and kill Raelynn, maybe we can stem the tide. Her death pays a handsome bounty. I hope you'll take advantage of the opportunity. Raelynn will finally get what's coming to her.

name: Nothing You Can Possess
objective: retrieve a decorative carving from the High Fane for Umbacano
first_tasks: locate the ruins of the High Fane

locations.name: High Fane
locations.description: an ancient Ayleid settlement known by a different name today

groups.name: Ayleids
groups.description: an ancient, extinct race of people

tools: the player has obtained artifacts for Umbacano before
Umbacano gives the player a sketch depicting the High Fane: the High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower
the drawing on the bottom of the page Umbacano gave the player depicts a carved panel from the central chamber of the High Fane
Umbacano gives the player the key to the inner chamber of the High Fane
description:
You have proven yourself more than a simple grave robber. I believe you can handle a more complicated assignment. Are you interested?
Here, take a look at this sketch. The ancient texts refer to this site only as the "High Fane." Do you know it? Your first task is to locate the ruins of the High Fane. I believe it must now be known by a different name.
The High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower, a very troubled time for that ancient people. A time I find most fascinating. The drawing on the bottom of the page I gave you depicts a carved panel from the central chamber of the High Fane. I believe this carving will shed new light on Ayleid history, if I am able to examine it closely. I would like you to retrieve it for me.
You will need this as well. It is the key to the inner chamber of the High Fane. I part with it reluctantly, so guard it well. It is what began my search for the High Fane, many years ago.

name: Sanguine, the Party Prince
objective: crash a dinner party at Castle Leyawiin and play a prank on the guests
first_tasks: find a way in to the dinner party

quest_giver.name: Sanguine
quest_giver.description: the lord of revelry, one of the Daedric Princes

characters.name: Countess
characters.description: the somber noblewoman who rules over Castle Leyawiin

tools: the player has summoned Sanguine
the Countess is hosting a dinner party
Sanguine gives the player a spell: the player should use it on the Countess and her guests to liven up the dinner party
the dinner party is invitation only
description:
Ah... another mortal come to beg Sanguine to add a bit of spice to an otherwise drab existence. I would have you perform a service for me.
The Castle Leyawiin is a dull, dreary place. The mistress is an especially somber soul, and tomorrow she will hold another excruciating dinner party. I want you to liven it up. Use this spell on the Countess and her guests. I think it will make the party much more interesting. You should probably try to be inconspicuous. Or they might kill you. Oh, and the party is by invitation only. You'll have to find a way in.
Have fun!

name: A Rat Problem
objective: take care of the rat problem, and return to Azzan
first_tasks: talk to Arvena Thelas about the rat problem in her house

quest_giver.name: Azzan
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

tools: the player has requested their first contract from Azzan
description:
A contract for you? I, Azzan, think I've got something that suits your experience. Arvena Thelas has some problem with rats in her house.
As I said, rats. I'm sure she can explain it to you better than I. She lives here in Anvil. Go and talk to her.
Go take care of the rats. Then talk to me. Good luck!

name: Mazoga the Orc
objective: report to Marius Caro the reason Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin
first_tasks: find out why Mazoga the Orc is in Leyawiin

characters.name: Mazoga
characters.description: an Orc woman who claims to be a knight

tools: the player does not know Marius Caro
description:
Marius Caro, by grace of the Gods, Count of Leyawiin. You are a stranger to me, but well-met. Perhaps you would like to do a service for Leyawiin?
I need your help. An Orc named Mazoga here claims to be a knight, but will not reveal her business. Find out why she is here, and report to me, and you will earn a reward suitable for those who serve Leyawiin.

name: Helping Hands
objective: hire a housekeeper for Rosethorn Hall
first_tasks: pay Eyja 150 gold to hire her as your housekeeper
tools: the player purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall
description:
Hello, I heard you purchased the Servants Quarters for Rosethorn Hall, and I was wondering if you had anyone in mind to fill that position?
For 150 gold and a roof over my head, I'm yours. Well, to help around the house I mean.

name: Order of the Virtuous Blood
objective: kill Roland Jenseric
first_tasks: search for clues about Roland Jenseric's whereabouts

first_task_locations.description: Roland Jenseric's house in the Temple District of the Imperial City

quest_giver.name: Seridur
quest_giver.description: an elderly vampire hunter, and the leader of the Order of the Virtuous Blood
quest_giver.location: the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood in the Imperial City

groups.name: Order of the Virtuous Blood
groups.description: an order of vampire hunters, who defend the Imperial City from vampires

tools: the player is a famous hero: the player has not met Seridur before
Seridur and his fellow vampire hunters are only 3 old men lacking the strength to defeat vampires in battle
Roland killed his girlfriend in the back garden of his house by sucking her blood out of her neck
the player should return to the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood if they have questions: the Order of the Virtuous Blood meet at night
description:
It's an honor to finally meet you. When I heard you were in town, I just had to send for your help. Your reputation precedes you. Oh, allow me to introduce myself. I am Seridur.
Welcome. You're now in the sanctuary of the Order of the Virtuous Blood. Few outside our circle have ever set foot in our hallowed hall. We are, for lack of a better word, defenders. We guard this city from an infestation that plagues it. We are vampire hunters. I'm sure you are familiar with those despicable beings. Feeding on the innocent as if they were cattle. Well, this group was formed to combat them. Alas, we are but 3 old men, not able to match the fighting prowess of the vampire. We lack the strength to defeat them in battle.
Our goal is to root out the vampires that live in our fair city. So far, we've been unsuccessful finding one until now. It's come to the Order's attention that Temple District resident Roland Jenseric is a vampire, and has already claimed one victim. That's where you come in. We want you to slay this vampire and cleanse the city of his filth before he can feed or kill again.
A few nights ago, I was roaming the city as I often do, looking for any signs of a vampire. As I headed past Roland's house I heard a cry. I rushed into the back garden to find Roland struggling with a woman he'd been courting. I tried to intervene, but he was too strong. He threw his lover to the ground and turned his attention on me. Luckily, I managed to run back into the street and escape his grasp. I hid for a while and then returned to the garden. Roland was gone and the woman was dead. She had two puncture marks on the nape of her neck. That's when I realized he was a vampire. The Order needs you to track him and destroy him.
I would start by searching his home. He hasn't been there for days, so it should be safe. Return to us here if you have questions. We meet at night.

name: Mercantile Training
objective: prove to Palonirya that you have enough capital to receive her expertise
first_tasks: collect 10,000 Septims
tools: the player asked mercantile training from Palonirya
description:
Training? Well, my dear, good business sense is just something that comes naturally to me. You've got to have the know-how, or else I can't teach you anything at all.
Do you have what it takes? Do you even know what it takes? Gold, that's what! Septims, and lots of them! Show me that you've got the starting capital, at least ten thousand in liquid assets.
Afterwards, I'll help you learn how to put it to good use.

name: A Bad Cough
objective: deliver a message about medicines for miners to Quintus
first_tasks: find Quintus

quest_giver.name: Sondas Drenim
quest_giver.location: a mine whose tunnels are getting deep into the rock

tools: the miners need medicines to combat the ore dust
description:
This mine is only a few years old, but I've been digging up ore for over a century.
We're getting to the point where the tunnels are getting deep into the rock. People complain of bad coughs and foul air. I've seen this before. We need some medicines to combat the ore dust. I was about to send a message to Windhelm for aid.
Could you deliver that message on my behalf? Take it to Quintus, in the White Phial.

name: Serving the Empire
objective: prove yourself worthy of joining the Imperial Legion
first_tasks: wipe out bandits

first_task_locations.name: Fort Hraggstad
first_task_locations.description: a bandit fortress to be turned into an Imperial garrison

quest_giver.name: Legate Rikke
quest_giver.description: a female leader in the Imperial Legion

tools: the ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim: most have fallen into disrepair and overrun with bandits
description:
I've got a good feeling about you. And I don't often get good feelings about anything. A warrior knows to trust her gut... I'm not going to go through the normal process with you. I've got a little test lined up. Pass that, and we'll talk about you joining the Legion.
The ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim. Sadly, most have fallen into disrepair. And nearly all have been overrun with bandits or other vagabonds. Fort Hraggstad is one of the few that remains mostly intact. We're going to install a garrison there, but first, you're going to clean out the bandits that have moved in.
Then, it's time for you to officially join the Legion.

name: Take Up Arms
objective: prove that you are worthy of joining the Companions
first_tasks: go with Vilkas out to the yard, and let him see what you can do

characters.name: Vilkas
characters.description: a male member of the Companions

tools: the player told Kodlak Whitemane that they want to join the Companions
description:
You would like to join the Companions? Would you now? Here, let me have a look at you. Hm. Yes, perhaps. A certain strength of spirit.
How are you in a battle, child? Don't feel like you need to show off for our sake. Vilkas, here, will be the one testing your mettle.
Let Vilkas take you out to the yard and see what you can do.

name: Restoration Ritual
